Major_Arcs.title: The Circus Saga
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Paul Bunyan at a circus, his confrontation with Billings and Matto Grasso's initial sabotage attempts, and Paul's eventual departure from the circus.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to the Circus
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Paul Bunyan as a circus performer and the general public's fascination with the circus animals.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Circus and the Giraffe

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Strongman Offer
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan intervenes in a conflict, defeats Billings and his ambushers, and is subsequently offered a job by the circus owner.

narrative_arcs.title: Investigating the Cry for Help and Confronting Billings
The Proposition: Becoming the New Strong Man

sub_scenes.title: Matto's Sabotage and Paul's Exit
sub_scenes.description: Matto Grasso's jealousy leads to arson and ape release, which Paul Bunyan handles, ultimately leading to Paul rejecting the strongman offer and leaving the circus.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Acclaim and Matto Grasso's Envy
Matto's Renewed Sabotage: The Ape Release
Discovery of the Loose Ape and Paul's Intervention
Arena Observation and Intention to Intervene
Rejection of Strongman Offer and Departure

Major_Arcs.title: Tales of the East - Part 1
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc presents two separate tales set in the East: Marco Polo's encounter with the Ogress of Tibet and a man's horrifying discovery of a severed talking head.

sub_scenes.title: Marco Polo's Peril
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo is attacked in Tibet, setting the stage for his adventures in the East.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Awful Ogress of Tibet

sub_scenes.title: Severed Head Discovery
sub_scenes.description: A man on horseback discovers a severed head in a forest, which surprisingly is alive and pleads for help.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of the Severed Talking Head
The Severed Head's Plea for Help

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Ogress
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo's journey to Hi-Toun, his encounter with the Ogress disguised as a starving mother, and his confrontation and escape from her castle.

sub_scenes.title: Rescue and Journey to Hi-Toun
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo rescues a man, receives a magical dagger, travels to Hi-Toun, and learns about the missing Princess Lotus.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Hi-Toun and King's Welcome
The King's Grief and the Missing Princess Lotus
Encounter with a Starving Mother and the Witch's Castle

sub_scenes.title: Witch's Castle and Reveal
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo enters the castle, discovers the Ogress's true form, and is attacked by her tusked mice.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'
Confrontation with the Mice and Sword Defense

sub_scenes.title: Capture and Escape
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo attempts to escape but is captured by the cloaked figure and then rescued by Princess Lotus and a male prisoner who uses the magic knife to escape.

narrative_arcs.title: Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father
Palace Arrival, Mourning Confusion, and Marriage Reward

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a story about a hidden treasure in Agra, India, narrated by a treasure keeper, involving betrayal, murder, and the dark side of wealth.

sub_scenes.title: Prison Colony and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: A treasure keeper begins narrating a tale of treasure. The scene shifts to a penal colony where a prisoner attempts to bribe Captain Brooking with the promise of treasure.

narrative_arcs.title: Prison Colony Labor and Guard Check
Request to Speak with Captain Brooking
Discovery of Betrayal and Captain's Escape
Release from Servitude and Fare to England
Arrival in England and Renewed Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Fatal End
sub_scenes.description: Jordan confronts Captain Brooking, leading to a violent confrontation in the attic where Brooking is killed, and the story concludes with a moral lesson.

narrative_arcs.title: Ascent to the Attic and Discovery of Treasure
Responding to Gunshot and Finding the Body
Aftermath and Calling the Homicide Squad
Moral of the Story: Money is Evil

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Dr. Styx's investigation of the haunted Matthews Estate, dealing with the vengeful spirit of Vincent Matthews and ultimately resolving the haunting.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction and Investigation
sub_scenes.description: Dr. Styx is introduced, and Henry Northrup arrives at Matthews Estate to investigate the supernatural disturbances caused by Vincent Matthews's ghost.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Warning at Matthews Place
Warning Before Entering the Haunted House

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Vincent's Ghost
sub_scenes.description: Henry confronts the ghost of Vincent Matthews, who reveals his hatred and the need for forgiveness from Rosalind.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Strength and Shift in Power
The Horrifying Revelation of Rosalind's Murder and Forgiveness

sub_scenes.title: Summoning and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Dr. Styx summons Rosalind's ghost, who forgives Vincent, leading to their departure and the resolution of the haunting.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Rest and Conditional Forgiveness
The Test of Brotherly Love and Rejection

Major_Arcs.title: The Voyages of Henry Hudson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc recounts the voyages of Henry Hudson, his quest for the Northwest Passage, the mutiny by his crew, and his tragic fate.

sub_scenes.title: Commission and Early Voyage
sub_scenes.description: The narrative introduces Henry Hudson, his commission by the Dutch East India Company, and his initial voyage to find the Northwest Passage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dutch East India Company's Request
Threat of Mutiny and Change of Course
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
Hudson's Resolve and Return to Holland

sub_scenes.title: Icebound and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's second voyage leads to the ship being icebound, culminating in a mutiny and Hudson being set adrift.

narrative_arcs.title: New Company and Continued Search for Passage
Extreme Northerly Route and Icebound Ship
Winter Quarters and Waiting for Spring Thaw
The Ice Melts and Voyage Resumes
Crew's Refusal and Demand to Return Home
Mutineers Return Home and Face Justice

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Hassan the Arabian Knight on a dangerous mission to rescue the kidnapped daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali from Kurgan and the Dread Tartars, showcasing his bravery and skill.

sub_scenes.title: Mission Briefing and Journey
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is summoned by the Caliph and tasked with a rescue mission, embarking on a perilous journey to find the kidnapped daughter.

narrative_arcs.title: The Summons and the Dangerous Mission
The Rescue Mission: Daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali
Signs of the Enemy at the Oasis

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Hassan infiltrates the Tartar camp, encounters a sentry, and makes contact with the kidnapped daughter before being discovered and captured.

narrative_arcs.title: Approaching the Tartar Camp Under Nightfall
Cloak as a Disguise and Infiltration Plan
Reaching the Prisoner's Tent and Contact
Discovery and Confrontation by Tartar Guards
Capture and Recognition as an Outsider

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Reward
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is brought before Kurgan, accepts a challenge to fight for his freedom and the daughter's release, and ultimately succeeds, earning his reward and a possible romance.

narrative_arcs.title: Terms of Combat and Kurgan's Doubt
Victory Shout and Defiant Last Words
Impending Departure and a Necessary Kiss
